message_1: What will happen when copper wire is placed into a silver nitrate solution and why? Write the balanced chemical equation for the reaction that takes place and describe the type of single replacement reaction that occurs.
message_2:
When a copper wire is placed into a silver nitrate solution, a single replacement reaction occurs. Copper is more reactive than silver, so it displaces silver from the silver nitrate solution, forming copper nitrate and solid silver. The copper wire will gradually become coated with silver, while the solution turns blue due to the formation of copper nitrate.

The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

Cu(s) + 2AgNO₃(aq) → Cu(NO₃)₂(aq) + 2Ag(s)

This is a single replacement reaction (also known as a single displacement reaction) because one element (copper) replaces another element (silver) in a compound (silver nitrate).
